_header: Alas alas that I was born
Note:
Foster (1940)
XFoster, Frances Allen. “Some English Words from the Fasciculus Morum.” Essays and Studies in Honor of Carleton Brown. Percy Waldron Long New York: NYU Press; London: Humphrey Milford, Oxford University Pres, 1940: 149-57, 31A; for another version in Fasciculus morum, see 265.
_description: The Sinner’s Lament, a tag usually in the Fasciculus morum, Version A

Bod187.Transcription:
Alas alas þat y was bornfor dom with dom y am for
                    lorn

Bod410.Transcription: Alas Alas þat I was bornfor dom by dom I am for lorn

BodLauMis111.Transcription:
Alas Alas that euer I was borenBody and soule I am
                    forloren

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
Alas alas þat I was bornBoth lyfe & sowle I am for
                    lorn
BodLauMis213.Note: Second occurrence in MS; written as prose.

BodLauMis568.Transcription:
alas alas þat y was borneffor dome wyt dome I am
                    forlorne

BodRawC670.Transcription:
Alas alas þat I was borenFor dome with dome I am for
                    loren
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 172.

CamGon71.Transcription:
Alas alas þat I was bornefor dome with dome I am for
                    lorne

EDU82.Transcription:
Alas alas that I was bornefor dome with dome I am for
                    lorne

Lincoln44.Transcription:
Alas alas þat I was bornfor dom with dome þus arn for
                    lorne

Spalding.Transcription:
Allas allas þat I was bornefor dome with dome I am
                    forlorne

WorcF19.Transcription:
Allas alas þat y was borynfor dome with dome y am
                    forlorn

WorcF126.Note:
Not in Fasciculus morum; written as prose in a Latin prose
                    sermon.
WorcF126.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             “The Gay Carol and Exemplum.” 
             Neuphilologische Mitteilunge
         77 (1976): 85-91: 90.
